body:
I think that warning comes from the gerrit end which doesn't like any lines > 70 chars.

I think the git-codereview tool could do more before involving gerrit.
On 7 Jan 2015 09:07, "Richard L. Hudson" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> When I did this I got a warning about the subject being too long. The next
> change has a fixed subject line.
>
> git mail -r rsc@golang.org,austin@google.com
> remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (8/8)
> remote: Processing changes: new: 1, done
> remote: (W) aa88053: commit subject >65 characters; use shorter first
> paragraph
> remote: (W) aa88053: too many commit message lines longer than 70
> characters; manually wrap lines
> remote:
> remote: New Changes:
> remote: https://go-review.googlesource.com/2349 Runtime: Increase GC
> concurrency. Run GC in its own
> background goroutine ...
> remote:
>
>
> On Tue, Jan 6, 2015 at 3:42 PM, Dave Cheney <notifications@github.com>
> wrote:
>
> > Gerrit makes a complete hash of the CL if there is no blank line between
> > the 1st and subsequent lines on the change description. Maybe
> > git-codereview should detect this and barf accordingly.
> >
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/9522>.
> >
>
